title: epi2me-labs/wf-pore-c
description: Workflow for analysing Pore-c data for chromatin conformation capture.

input_options.title: Input Options
input_options.description: Parameters for finding and handling input data for analysis.

bam.title: Unaligned BAM
bam.description: An unaligned BAM file containing Pore-C concatemer sequences
bam.help_text: This accepts one of three cases: (i) the path to a single BAM file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing BAM files; (iii) the path to a directory containing one level of sub-directories which in turn contain BAM files. In the first and second case, a sample name can be supplied with `--sample`. In the last case, the data is assumed to be multiplexed with the names of the sub-directories as barcodes. In this case, a sample sheet can be provided with `--sample_sheet`.

fastq.title: FASTQ
fastq.description: FASTQ files to use in the analysis.
fastq.help_text: This accepts one of three cases: (i) the path to a single FASTQ file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing FASTQ files; (iii) the path to a directory containing one level of sub-directories which in turn contain FASTQ files. In the first and second case, a sample name can be supplied with `--sample`. In the last case, the data is assumed to be multiplexed with the names of the sub-directories as barcodes. In this case, a sample sheet can be provided with `--sample_sheet`.

sample_sheet.title: Sample sheet
sample_sheet.description: A CSV file used to map barcodes to sample aliases and optionally provide per-sample parameters. The sample sheet can be provided when the input data is a directory containing sub-directories with FASTQ files.
sample_sheet.help_text: The sample sheet is a CSV file with, minimally, columns named `barcode` and `alias`. Optionally, a `cutter` column can contain the name of the enzyme used per sample (see the `--cutter` parameter for more details) and a `vcf` column can be used to provide a phased VCF file per sample if you require haplotagged alignments.

sample.description: A single sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a single .fastq(.gz) file or directory of .fastq(.gz) files.

analyse_unclassified.description: Analyse unclassified reads from input directory. By default the workflow will not process reads in the unclassified directory.
analyse_unclassified.help_text: If selected and if the input is a multiplex directory the workflow will also process the unclassified directory.

ref.title: Reference FASTA
ref.description: A fasta file containing the reference genome to map against

vcf.title: VCF
vcf.description: An optional phased VCF file that will be used to haplotag alignments

cutter.description: The enzyme used in the restriction digest.
cutter.help_text: Any enzyme from the Biopython restriction dictionary can be used. See `https://github.com/biopython/biopython/blob/master/Bio/Restriction/Restriction_Dictionary.py`

output_options.title: Output Options
output_options.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

hi_c.description: Output a Hi-C formatted file; will convert pairs format to a Hi-C (`.hic`) file which will be compatible with [juicer](https://github.com/aidenlab/juicer)
hi_c.help_text: Load this file with [Juice box](https://www.aidenlab.org/juicebox/) for an alternative contact map visualisation.

bed.description: Output a BED file of monomer alignments for use with downstream tools.
bed.help_text: Will use the name sorted bam to create a BED file compatible with downstream tools including scaffolding tool [Yahs](https://github.com/c-zhou/yahs).

advanced_options.title: Advanced Options
advanced_options.description: Avanced options for configuring processes inside the workflow.

chunk_size.description: Process input in chunks of this number of reads.
chunk_size.help_text: To reduce per-process memory requirements for large datasets, process the inputs in chunks of reads. Set to 0 to process entire dataset in one go.

threads.description: Set maximum number of threads to use for more intense processes (limited by config executor cpus). We recommend a minimum of 4, but if available 19.
threads.help: Increasing this will speed up some individual processes, but reduce the number of processes that can run in parallel, potentially increasing the time for the workflow to run overall.

advanced_options.help_text: These advanced options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

pore_c_tools_options.title: Pore-C Tools Options
pore_c_tools_options.description: Parameters to control the pore-c tools

minimap2_settings.description: The minimap2 settings for mapping monomers

max_monomers.description: The maximum number of monomers allowed for a read to be included in downstream analysis.
max_monomers.help: Any reads that have more than this number will be filtered out, and output in a per sample filtered_bam file.

summary_json.description: Output pore-c-py annotation summary in json format.

chromunity.help_text: See the chromunity documentation for further details 'https://github.com/mskilab/chromunity'.

chromunity_merge_distance.description: Merge colinear alignments separated by less than this base pair distance into a single monomer.

4dn_files_options.title: 4DN files Options
4dn_files_options.description: Create files for the 4D nucleome toolset

pairs.description: Create a 4DN-format pairs file (also calculate stats).
pairs.help_text: Outputs a directory with a pairs stats report and a pairs file which can be used for downstream anaylsis.

pairtools_chunksize.description: Number of pairs to be processed in each chunk in the prepare_hic process which uses the pairtools dedup tool.
pairtools_chunksize.help_text: Reduce for lower memory footprint. Below 10,000 performance starts suffering significantly.

mcool.title: Multi-resolution cooler file (mcool)
mcool.description: Create a multi-resolution cooler file. Will output the cooler formatted file which you can load with cooler.

cool_bin_size.title: Cooler file bin size
cool_bin_size.description: The bin size of the cooler output file in base pairs.

mcool_resolutions.description: The resolutions of the mcool file in pixels (see cooler documentation for details).
mcool_resolutions.help_text: Comma-separated list of target resolutions. Use suffixes B or N to specify a progression: B for binary (geometric steps of factor 2), N for nice (geometric steps of factor 10 interleaved with steps of 2 and 5). This is the equivalent of the `--resolutions` flag in cooler; see an example here 'https://cooler.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli.html'.

paired_end_bam_options.title: Paired-end BAM Options
paired_end_bam_options.description: Create mock paired-end BAM files for legacy tools

filter_pairs.description: Filter paired end reads using minimum and maximum distance parameters.

paired_end_minimum_distance.description: Remove trans pairs and cis- pairs separated by a distance shorter than this

paired_end_maximum_distance.description: Remove trans pairs and cis- pairs separated by a distance greater than this

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.

resources.run_time: 12 hours for 100GB input BAM using the recommended resources, this will vary depending on number of monomers found per read.
